data.what_is:
Wishpond is a platform of simple tools for lead generation and marketing automation used by more than 5,000 businesses:


Landing Pages:  Build, publish & A/B split test mobile-responsive Landing Pages in minutes.

Website Popups: Convert more website visitors into leads with website popup forms.

Forms: Embed Lead-Generation Forms on your website and blog.

Contests & Promotions: Run Facebook Sweepstakes, Photo Contests, Instagram Hashtag Contests and more.

Marketing Automation: Trigger personalized emails to your Leads based on their activity and personal detail.

Email Marketing: Personalize your emails to each Lead based on any activity or personal details.

Lead Management: Create Lists based on your Leads' activity on your site & campaigns.

Lead Scoring: Score your leads based on their activity and personal details to see which one are ready to buy.

Lead Profiles: Get insight into your Leads. View their website activity, emails they've opened & more.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file. 17 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: As reported in 13 Wishpond reviews. Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product. 11 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Customization
features.content: System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements This feature was mentioned in 21 Wishpond reviews.

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action. 21 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Based on 19 Wishpond reviews. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: As reported in 12 Wishpond reviews. Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.  17 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically 34 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending. This feature was mentioned in 31 Wishpond reviews.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: As reported in 29 Wishpond reviews. Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: As reported in 31 Wishpond reviews. Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information. 37 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: As reported in 29 Wishpond reviews. Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: Based on 22 Wishpond reviews. Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages. 38 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: As reported in 34 Wishpond reviews. A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database. This feature was mentioned in 28 Wishpond reviews.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: As reported in 24 Wishpond reviews. Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: As reported in 18 Wishpond reviews. Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Based on 24 Wishpond reviews. Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks. 25 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: As reported in 21 Wishpond reviews. Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: As reported in 21 Wishpond reviews. Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: As reported in 19 Wishpond reviews. Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar.

features.name: Calendaring
features.content: Maintain a marketing calendar across multiple groups. Manage the calendar for the entire marketing department, from promotions to content to PR. 12 reviewers of Wishpond have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Social Campaigns
features.content: As reported in 30 Wishpond reviews. Schedule automated posts to one or more social accounts; use or integrate with URL shortening services; and measure likes, comments, replies, and retweets.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails. This feature was mentioned in 29 Wishpond reviews.

features.name: Basic Reporting
features.content: As reported in 37 Wishpond reviews. Access pre-built and custom reports and dashboards to measure leads by source/campaign/month, email performance, landing page performance, and web and social activity. Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

Use anonymous company look-up to identify anonymous visitors.  Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Having a team to work with who does the tasks we're working on regularly has been very helpful for my small business. They can do things quickly and easily so that I can focus on what I do best.
Their customer service has been excellent. Every person I've worked with has been very supportive and helpful to resolve things and keep everything running smoothly.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Clarity of communication can be hard sometimes with distance and time zones, as well as having to get my goals and ideas into workable tasks for others.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
They are helping me automate some tasks. They are creating a workable landing page. They are helping greatly to focus my seo.

initial_reviews.review_title: Lacking Effective Communication, Follow Up and Integrity
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
The marketing Wishpond has is effective in that I was certain they had all the resources to deliver what they promote.
Wishpond is also highly effective at collecting funds for their services.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
1. There is no quality control for the services they deliver.
2. There is a lack of effective communication. There were missed meetings, and or meetings without agendas.
3. They have exceptionally poor customer service for something that is quite simple.

Integration of a solution has not worked.
Wishpond does not have integrity as part of its service delivery or value its relationship with its customers.
They took a canned approach in how they said they were meeting the needs of my project.
This means there was no connection or meaning in what they were producing.
A simple project that would take less than 3 weeks to organise with any other provider is taking more than 90 days with Wishpond and there is no appearance they will ever deliver.

They agreed to build a solution on a third-party platform.
It has been more than 3 months and they still have not completed it.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
Wishpond was meant to be a solution partner for services that would support our neurodiverse stakeholders to communicate more effectively.
They did not deliver.

initial_reviews.review_title: A Good Place to Start with Marketing your Business
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
We chose Wishpond because they put together a good plan of attack and opened the company up to new marketing ideas and platforms.  The content they made was well produced and the team we were provided was helpful and genuinely cared.

Their pricing is right on par for what you would spend anywhere.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
We have a unique product that needs a lot of attention because it targets very specific individuals.  When you hire ANY marketing company you realize how fast time flys by..Weeks turn into months in no time.  Sometimes the results are not what you expect and as immediate as you hope, but this is part of the industry.

Having a good plan of attack and executing a plan are two different things.  Attention and meetings by the hired company and Wishpond need to be clear and concise.  Results are not immediate and may take time.  I would use them in the future with a differnt approach.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
They are helping my marketing strategy and gaining us more exposure

We love the automations that were created and were very very impressed. I would say the emails, landing page, and all the pop up designs met our expectatoins and matched our brand.

We are very happy with our end result and I suppose the BEST news yet have already started generating leads and seeing coupon codes coming in and making sales!

initial_reviews.review_title: Wishpond pretty good for most small businesses
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Wishpond genuinly cares about its clients that it serves. When I had issues arrise, they were quick to get someone on the case and solve them in a timely manner!

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Wishpond markets itself as an all inclusive marketing service, and I think they are embilishing a little bit when they say that. There are many things Wishpond is not able to do or integrate with, and some minor bugs in the program itself. I do wish that they were more upfront with limitations, specifically domain hosting limitations, and recomended ad spend.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
Wishpond is helping greatly to solve the issue I have of marketing materials. By using Wishpond, I was able to get those materials to begin putting ads out for my small business.

all_reviews.review_title: Lacking Effective Communication, Follow Up and Integrity

The marketing Wishpond has is effective in that I was certain they had all the resources to deliver what they promote.
Wishpond is also highly effective at collecting funds for their services.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
1. There is no quality control for the services they deliver.
2. There is a lack of effective communication. There were missed meetings, and or meetings without agendas.
3. They have exceptionally poor customer service for something that is quite simple.

Integration of a solution has not worked.
Wishpond does not have integrity as part of its service delivery or value its relationship with its customers.
They took a canned approach in how they said they were meeting the needs of my project.
This means there was no connection or meaning in what they were producing.
A simple project that would take less than 3 weeks to organise with any other provider is taking more than 90 days with Wishpond and there is no appearance they will ever deliver.

They agreed to build a solution on a third-party platform.
It has been more than 3 months and they still have not completed it.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
Wishpond was meant to be a solution partner for services that would support our neurodiverse stakeholders to communicate more effectively.
They did not deliver.

all_reviews.review_title: I strongly advise against doing business with Wishpond
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
The contest campaign went ok, I gained appox. 800 leads.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
1. I did not receive 1 campaign every 2 months.
2. I did not receive any phone numbers to contact staff.
3. The quality of the images in the ads and emails were poor.
4. Not all of the emails in the campaign were delivered.
5. The quality of writing in the mails was poor.  Very general and grammar issues as if the individual did not speak English well.
6. They continue to charge my credit card even after I revoked that authorization, cancelled that credit card and they terminated the agreement.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
The company terms do not appear in the agreement/contract you sign.  The contract renews unless you request it to stop 2 months in advance.  There are no termination terms in the agreement.  I can not figure out how much sales tax they are charging me.  Once they have your credit card they will force the billings to go through even after you revoke authorization.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
I needed to increase my sales.  After 2 campaigns, I had 4 sales total.

all_reviews.review_title: Wishpond could be a great product if they listen to customer feedback.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
I like landing pages as  they can be easily customized. I also like that you copy html code of landing page and paste it to any website.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
The company appears to be international. After logging in, you can select your language from drop down list. Even if you select your preferred language, all text and templates remain in English. If you live in a non-English speaking country, Wishpond is essentially unusable. There are little things missing to make Wishpond great and usable internationally, but their support is the worst you can imagine. They don't listen to customer feedback. A few examples:
Two years ago I requested that they enable the editing and translation of the "Unsubscribe" button and "Preferences" in the footer of an email so that I could use email marketing in Europe to comply with the GDPR regulation. I sent them translations and communicated frequently with support, but they did nothing.
Recently Wishpond introduced a new feature called "Appointments". This is a very useful feature as customers can book an appointment date and time with you. However, it has one major problem because the calendar is only in English and cannot be translated. The time format cannot be set in 24 hours format.  Again if you come from a non-English speaking country this feature is unusable. I have contacted support to enable translation of the calendar into other languages, but as always their response negative: it is currently only in English, we don't know if we will enable translation into other languages.
It's a shame. Wishpond is a 99% finished product that could be used in non-English speaking countries, but because their development team is not willing to finish 1% it cannot be used at all.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
I work as an agency and helping to small companies get more leads and clients. Wispond would be an excellent tool for internet marketing, but I cannot use it in Europe as Wishpond does not enable the translation of some elements.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Email marketing is my bread and butter. I need to have absolute trust in the platform I'm working with.
Setting my campaigns and flows was very easy for me to do and they work seamlessly.
Until now, I haven't experienced any deliverability issues (but make sure to clean your list properly anyway).
I've created all kinds of automation, from basic to advanced, and they do not fail.
Webhooks, API, and Direct Integrations are all available for me, and I use them daily to integrate with 3rd party tools I'm using.
The support team is amazing and they do whatever they can to help you (also quick to reply). For me, that's key!
I'm also aware of the fact that WishPond offers many other features, which I still haven't had the opportunity to take advantage of; Landing Pages, Sweepstakes, Vote Contest, and the newly introduced feature: Appointments.
I'm sure these too will come in handy in the future, as WishPond guys definitely know what they are doing.
Just give it a try! I'm sure you'll like it.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
The UI is slightly outdated. For me, that's not much of a big deal. I look for substance and that's something that WishPond does offer.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am constantly building my email list and WishPond is helping me automate everything that's related to my email marketing.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use automation software, perfect for ecommerce
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Wishpond is a well-built marketing automation platform that meets the needs of many smaller websites without the large price tag of competitors. To me, it seems extremely useful to "mom and pop" e-commerce shops that really rely on social media for brand exposure. It is easy to use, works well and has a strong focus on social. Of all of the marketing automation platforms that I have seen, it has the best features for social campaigns and sweepstakes, which makes it ideal for retail e-commerce businesses.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
It has a strong focus on social media, which is great, but I feel like it relies too much on social. Its user experience leaves a bit to be desired, but it does get the point across. Just feels a bit amateurish. I wish it had more integrations, but for its price point, you can't really expect them to offer more than what they do.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
There are other competitors that offer similar features at the same price point and some even cheaper, so make sure to do your homework. But if you are running an e-commerce site and rely heavily on social media for leads and brand exposure, then Wishpond might be the perfect solution for you.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful eMail Automation and Client-Engagement Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Great variety of prospect-engagement tools: rate leads based on their activities, put them automatically on lists based on their activities; contests, sweapstakes, and other "gamification" lead-gen tools; pop-ups of multiple types (slide in, exit, ad-bar, etc.).

Truly one of the most complete and fairly easy to use platforms I owned in the past close to 2 decades.

Customer support: EXCELLENT! (quick and super-helpful)

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Some of my eMail campaigns took 10 to 20 minutes - at times even more - to send out, AFTER someone opts into a form on my website.  In past tools I used, the most it took was 5 to 10 minutes; usually, the messages would show up in people's inboxes in seconds after they opted in.  Regardless of this, the benefits outweigh this small negative; besides, it gives me a chance to say honestly on my Thank You page that "Your freebie will be in your eMail inbox in about 10 minutes... meanwhile, watch this video..."  I turn the negative into a positive.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
If you need an intelligent autoresponder, eMail Automation, lead-generation tool that has all the bells and whistles one needs to connect with leads and sell more effectively, I highly recommend Wishpond!  Initially, perhaps not as "intuitive" and easy to use like aWeber or 1ShoppingCart, BUT, customer-support is super-responsive and once I know where everything is, it's a pleasure to use it.   It's also definitely more complete, with way more features, than services I used in the past, hence perhaps a little more complex.  However, after using it for a few months, I confidently use it daily.

For a while I used three such services. By now I transfered all of my automations to Wishpond. I love it 

I highly recommend it

Referal-marketing (with Referral Bonus Contests)

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Wishpond has me working with Sofia and she has been an absolute dream to work with!  I've never done much marketing for my ecommerce store especially having been burned by  a good number of self-proclaimed "marketing professionals" who promise the world, but cannot deliver even in the slightest. Sofia's attention to detail is amazing and her availability is pretty much 24/7, which is great for me because I work odd hours, seven days a week. Ability to communicate efficiently and pay close attention to detail are very high on my priority list and both of these aspects are covered by WP.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Since I'm not very tech-savvy when it comes to social media, setting up some of the accounts (connecting Fb to IG, and both to the WP platform), things got fairly frustrating for me, but Sofia took care of all of it while walking me through the process.  The only thing I'm having trouble with is figuring out how to reply to both Fb and IG comments since the promotions are done through the WP platform and not directly to my social media accounts...it's not as easy as signing on and replying to comments on my page.  I think I'll have to somehow connect through the WP platform, so that's just another step I'll have to go through.  That's really all that I dislike, but I'm sure it's not difficult to figure out.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
Bringing in new followers has been a problem since I've started nearly from scratch once I rebranded my store.  As they say, "Content is King", and I have content to push, but it doesn't reach NEW customers.  The first promo that Sofia set up for brought in nearly 100 new customers each day!  I'm obviously realizing the benefits of hiring a PROFESSIONAL company to handle the promos rather than trying to find the time to [insufficiently] build promotional campaigns on my own.

all_reviews.review_title: Makes me wonder if someone actually works there
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
That they are based in Canada but don't let that fool you.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
At first their representative promised that he could replace my writer, marketer and social media person and replace it Wishpond services. That was a lie and I find out the man was fired but that left me with a 6 month contract and no one to do the job promised as I had fired the people I used to work with. That's one.

Second getting a response from them is the worst part. No one responds to emails not even their accounting department but they won't stop themselves from taking the money from small business owners and then serve their high paying clients with it!

Third can you believe it takes over a month to set up an add? They were supposed to set up a bar on my website and couldn't do it within 3 months?!? You always have to run after them to do their job. Defeats the purpose of  hiring someone to do something in order to give you more time to take care of your business.

Fourth the only thing that they did that was good for us was a giveaway but once the giveaway was done it took over a week to get the emails to sens out to the losers and the winner! How disorganized do you have to be? I was getting messages left and right asking who won. In the end I sent the email to the winner. Defeats the purpose of hiring someone to take care of it.

I go could on with my disappointment and bad experience with them but in all honesty I am just 100% dissatisfied with them and with the way they handled my account within the past 6 months.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
They were hired to grow my sales, send my monthly blog & newsletter and grow my online presence. Although in truth their service is a problem within itself, I am not using them anymore. The only good thing was the giveaway and even that didn't go smoothly.

all_reviews.review_title: These people are evil. I can explain...
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
First, I'd like to start off by saying this is the most useless app I have ever paid for. We are using their contest feature, and they DON'T EVEN HAVE A SEARCH BAR to search for a particular lead by name or email address.

Can you image this? -- This is an app that is supposed to save us time and money. Yet, they don't have a simple search function to search for any leads you've collected. So we will have to spend more time sifting through 1,000s of leads manually just to find the one we are looking for.

The most evil part about this is that THEY KEEP RAISING THE PRICE. I've seen the price for the basic plan go from $75 - to $99 - to $149 in LESS THAN 6 MONTHS (during a f**king pandemic too!)

There's nothing wrong with raising your price, but I mean, try to add some value to make us feel like we are actually getting something for the price increase. The app is basic as h*ll. There are so many basic features that are missing, and the backend User Interface for editing your contest looks like something from 1995.

This is the worst company I have ever had the displeasure of using. I should have known this, because of how difficult it was to even do business with them in the first place. You literally had to do a "consultation", then wait for the sales person to send you a trial link before you could ever see what the program does yourself.

And check this out! -- When you register for the trial, they force you to go for the yearly plan. You have to remember to cancel the yearly plan and switch to monthly before the trial period is over. I mean, just pure evil practice on top of evil practices.

I wouldn't recommend Wishpunk to my worst enemy. Good people with good products don't do the things these guys do.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Missing basic features -- LIKE A SEARCH BAR to search for your leads, or even ability to track your page with Google Analytics without upgrading to the highest fr**king plan. So ridiculous!

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
This may have to be your last option. It's useable, but could frustrate you if you've tried more modern apps with basic functions included.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
We ere trying to use their Voting Contest feature. It seems to serve the purpose we were going for, but behind all the nice graphics on their website sales page is a basic app that probably hasn't been updated in 20 years+.

First, I'd like to start off by saying this is the most useless app I have ever paid for. We are using their contest feature, and they DON'T EVEN HAVE A SEARCH BAR to search for a particular lead by name or email address.

Can you image this? -- This is an app that is supposed to save us time and money. Yet, they don't have a simple search function to search for any leads you've collected. So we will have to spend more time sifting through 1,000s of leads manually just to find the one we are looking for.

The most evil part about this is that THEY KEEP RAISING THE PRICE. I've seen the price for the basic plan go from $75 - to $99 - to $149 in LESS THAN 6 MONTHS (during a f**king pandemic too!)

There's nothing wrong with raising your price, but I mean, try to add some value to make us feel like we are actually getting something for the price increase. The app is basic as h*ll. There are so many basic features that are missing, and the backend User Interface for editing your contest looks like something from 1995.

This is the worst company I have ever had the displeasure of using. I should have known this, because of how difficult it was to even do business with them in the first place. You literally had to do a "consultation", then wait for the sales person to send you a trial link before you could ever see what the program does yourself.

And check this out! -- When you register for the trial, they force you to go for the yearly plan. You have to remember to cancel the yearly plan and switch to monthly before the trial period is over. I mean, just pure evil practice on top of evil practices.

I wouldn't recommend Wishpunk to my worst enemy. Good people with good products don't do the things these guys do.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Wishpond?
review_question_answers.answer: Missing basic features -- LIKE A SEARCH BAR to search for your leads, or even ability to track your page with Google Analytics without upgrading to the highest fr**king plan. So ridiculous!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
I like the responsiveness from our Program Manager, Alethia Bravo. She is great to work with and has helped build our sales eco-system.

I have also been very impressed with the photos that Wishpond has created for the marketing efforts. They are professional capture the essence of what we offer.

Wishpond has also demonstrated their expertise with different marketing methods including Facebook and Google Merchant. With their help I have been able to set up a Google Merchant shop. It is amazing how complex it is getting to use these different tools and having someone with expertise to offer suggestions really help

Lastly, everyone we have worked with at Wishpond had been pleasant and responsive.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Missing insights Marketing cost to Sales. Sales have lagged at different times and it is not clear as to why. I know this is a pretty hard thing to measure but it would be of great help.

There also seems to be a lag between campaigns. Prior to using Wishpond we were doing our own social media advertising and we had a pretty steady flow. When we started using Wishpond we saw a big jump in performance but then lags. In looking at the data those lags line up with the gaps between campaigns. I just wonder if we should be doing other things there.

Another thing is that we are continuing to run some marketing efforts in parallel with Wishpond for a number of reasons. We try to coordinate as much as we can but the efforts feel very separate some times. Perhaps this is something we need to discuss more in the coordination meetings.

Lastly, I cannot tell when campaigns actually start. That is probably an issue from my side but except for Alethia telling me there is no indicator. I do get the weekly updates but do not see what is actually going out. I think for Drip campaigns my team should always be included.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
We started with Wishpond to improve our digital marketing presence. Initially we had a big boost in sales but that has leveled off somewhat.

We also wanted to add more professional marketing approach which includes campaigns (regular and drip). I think the pictures and layouts of the landing pages have added to this.

As part of this we wanted to grow our base. Alpine Labs had a large email list (>55K) but we suspect that it was mostly existing users. One of the goals is to get to new targets. We believe that working with Wishpond has helped but so be honest we are not completely sure.

The biggest problem we are worried about is growing sales. The numbers indicate that we have done so though as pointed out in the previous question it is a little more cyclical than we would hope.

I use Wishpond mostly for email marketing and lead management, the amount of information that you can see about a lead it's actually impressive if w you work with a team that knows its way around data and customer journey you can actually get a ton out of this platform, especially if you are using Shopify since you can install an integration that allows you to pull all your store data and update any lead properties based on their purchased or their behavior.

In addition to all that you create a ton of assets like website popups, welcome mats, or landing pages that can help you reinforce any parts of your funnel with an easy to use of marketing automation builder, I think that this is one of the best tools you can get out there and it is totally worth its price, and If you don't have the team or the time to do everything yourself their fully managed team has you covered.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Until today everything has been amazing, there is nothing I dislike, but once the app crashed, besides that I can't think of anything else.

You should have at least a minimum marketing knowledge

Wishpond has beautiful preset templates that make building a contest fast and easy. All I have to do is change a picture, add the logo and update font. The  pages look professional and have increased our contest engagement.
There is a wide variety of contests to choose from. There are photo contests with voting, social media engagement and just plain enter to win contests. Everything we need.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Every once in a while you want to customize a page a little more. The templates make this a little challenging as there isn't much play with alignments and spacing. MailChimp integration needs a filter option. I only want certain entries to be exported and it's an all or none feature.
Every contest except the Bonus Entry contest has a Select Winner feature. I wish the bonus entry did as well.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have increased user engagement with contests as well  as increased our emailing lists by several thousand. Great way to get our audience interacting with us.

all_reviews.review_title: Nice landing page designer, but unreliable lead capture and email delivery are troubling.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
The landing page editor is intuitive and easy to use...but so are many other vendors. And the pop-up function is similarly easy to understand, and once you figure out the Wordpress integration  (I used  the 'Insert Headers and Footers' wordpress plugin, which made it easy), the pop-up feature seems to work fine.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Multi-hour delays in seeing leads show up in the system, delays/unreliable email delivery to new sign-ups, limited documentation (the instructions for adding snippet code to Wordpress site is a broken link?!)  The overall system refresh was also slightly slow...not a dealbreaker, but bothersome.

The tech support efforts have been discouraging, with reassurances that the problem "would be resolved soon" after several days. As a start-up with limited resources,  I can't afford to wait and wonder if emails are going to get sent or responsiveness will be an issue.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am trying to use it for standard email marketing, but will likely need to go to a more reliable platform (ConvertKit, Kababi, MailerLite, etc.)

I wasn't able to recognize any benefits using Wishpond, unfortunately. Our requirements are not that demanding, frankly, but we need to have confidence that the solution is going to be reliable and responsive.

all_reviews.review_title: Wishpond - one of the easiest landing page builders I've ever used
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Drag and drop elements.  Easy to re-size.  There isn't a learning curve with this.  You can easily figure out how to use this software.  And if you get stuck, their support people  are really responsive.   I've only had to wait one time for an answer.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
It doesn't have a spell check function.  Since I have some non-US teammates.  Spell check is essential for us.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easy, fast landing page and pop up creator that has split test capabilities.  It's so easy to work with and you can complete your page and either use a custom domain or embed it into a web page.  Or you can just use the url Wishpond gives you.

For SEO purposes either use the custom domain or the wishpond url.  If you embed the content in a page, the search engine spiders can't "crawl" your content.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
They created a decent land page, although hosted it in the wrong place.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
They originally hosted my landing page on their 3rd party site, sending the traffic to them & not my e-commerce site without discussing it with me first. I lost valuable data being reported to Google Analytics before it was corrected.

Using my ad spend, their pop up links misdirected my audience to Wishpond's FB page & website, not my own. I found this 7 days after testing the links myself. There is zero quality control & no one checks the final product before it goes live. Wishpond considers these "small mistakes" - although its amateur hour 24/7.

There is zero quality control & no customer service. Although I have documented frustrations throughout this entire process, they have told me to reference their contract that does not include any language about the quality of services rendered.

Wishpond has published multiple mistakes & errors throughout the duration of both my campaigns, compromising the integrity of my brand.

I have spent $2000 with Wishpond (not including my out of pocket advertising expenses of hundreds of dollars) & have made $500 in sales. Bad ROI, bad investment.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
You are better off learning how to do everything yourself.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have figured out that I can solve all of these problems on my own without Wishpond's help, therefore am terminating my contract early. If you are unhappy with your services they will charge you 50% of the remaining contract. Run away, & fast!

Wishpond has made it so much easier to deal with my clients. I have the flexibility to create campaigns and implement in different ways according to how my client is setup. For example, I can create a landing page and have the option too embed on their current website with ease or have on my clients domain as well as use Wishponds subdomains. I can now create campaigns at half the time i used to with all the tools Wishpond have to offer. Another added benefit which is a cherry on the top, are the large amount of courses, ranging from design to marketing. They provide best practices and really hold your hand through the entire journey. Thanks Wishpond, your product is a breath of fresh air compared to a-lot of useless softwares out in the market. I can see why Wishpond continue to grow and have stamped their authority in this industry. A no brainer for anyone who is looking for a software that ticks all the boxes.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Wishpond allowed us to have an easy to use platform for photo contest for our clients. The set up is straight forward and gathering entrant and voter information was also very easy.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
We had been using their software for over 2 years when a close race for a cash prize for our latest photo Contest had an issue. At the end of the contest, one contest was one vote ahead of another. While the contest was still finished, it showed that the loser from the day before was ahead by 1 point. For some reason 2 votes came in after the conclusion of the contest. We had to give both participants the prize. We tried to work with Wishpond and had timestamp proof in the back end that their software messed up, and over time they started to ignore us when we asked for compensation for their error. Then they went MIA and we have not used them since.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
Use this platform for the most simple of contests. If it is a contest that reaches thousands, there may be discrepancies with final voting numbers.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were able to use Wishpond for a simple photo Contest. The best part was setting up photo contests were extremely fast.

all_reviews.review_title: Horrible Customer Service from Accounts department
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
Quick response when contacting wishpond, customer service guys were nice and quick to help when something was hard to understand. Features were easy to work with.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
No warning for trial period ending. Many email did not get a confirmation up till 4 to 6 hours later. (Primarily gmail accounts). Some European email addresses failed to confirm vote. Price is way to high for the service. Accounts department has no grace.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
Warn people about the trial period ending.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
The call centre always responded immediate and kind. But it seems that the tech team and accounts team do not really bother to care about the users. I received no notification that the trial period was over and paid 580USD for a service that does not work correctly.

When contacting accounts requesting a refund (10 days after the money got taken out of my account) - I got told that regardless of the service failing, I was 5 days (!?) too late and because I still had 6000 conversions I was not eligible for a refund.

Reading other reviews on the web, I can see I was not the only one experiencing issues with their ruthless accounts team. To me, not something that is considered "customer friendly service".

all_reviews.review_title: A go-to platform for my agency
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
TRANSPARENCY - Unlike a lot of marketing platforms, Wishpond actually does what it advertises. The platform is user-friendly and intuitive. And I am always confident that I won't be tricked into over-promised features and delivered value.

PRICE - I also like that pricing is so fair & there is no price gouging. I don't feel like I am being ripped off & the easy start-stop payment plans makes it easy to work with shifting client budgets without being on the hook to pay for a platform you aren't utilizing.

FLEXIBILITY - I love how customizable the platform is. I can essentially imagine a campaign/workflow and am never nervous that Wishpond won't be able to accommodate. There is a workaround or a feature for just about anything & I appreciate that.

SERVICE - No lie, upon contacting "chat" and being connected to Nick, I discovered he was the most informative, helpful Customer Service Desk/Support person I have ever spoken with in my entire life. I am 33. Give him a raise but don't take him away from his job. He's gold. I wish I encountered more people like him when I am in need of support & real answers. Bravo, Nick. And thanks to Wishpond for the great customer service.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Sometimes the platform can be a little slow (ie downloading leads)
I would love a more robust, in-depth reporting dashboard
More design-friendly options would be great (better web fonts, cleaner more modern templates, etc.)

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
Do it.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
A ton but the two biggest & most important are:
1. Being able to quickly execute digital + social campaigns without the need for a programmer or getting my clients IT department involved.
2. Being able to test, learn, & optimize methods of entry, lead generation, etc.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
I like the variety of campaigns that the software offers. It enables you to create landing pages, social media contests, and email followup sequences all in the same platform. I like clickfunnels as well, but with Wishpond, you get more features for your money with Wishpond.  Overall, if you want a marketing platform that is just going to do everything you want it to (without bothering with 100 integrations), Wishpond is a great option for a great price.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
I imagine that Wishpond is not as good with SEO as platforms like Wordpress. This is to be expected though, as that is not its primary function. I also haven't tried SEO with Wishpond, so I can't say for sure that it is lacking in that area. The software is more expensive than LeadPages and does not have as many options to choose from as Clickfunnels, although it has more features than LeadPages and clickfunnels at the same price point.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
My company works with a lot of entry-level and intern-level marketers and Wishpond is a very easy platform for them to learn and master quickly. It helps them build campaigns and learn marketing concepts without jumping through all the hoops of a platform like WordPress.

all_reviews.review_title: Extensive automation software that leaves little to be desired...
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
In a world where human tasking is slow and counter-productive in business, one of my favourite tools is Wishpond.

It is a relatively easy-to-use marketing automation software that makes drip campaigns, social media contests and lead scoring a painless process. Great for building your brand and email lists!

Compared to the other tools out there, Wishpond is very intuitive (even for non-techies) and the interface is easy on the eye -- features I always hope for in any app.

The best part? It CAN be incredibly simple ... But you can ALSO go very complex and completely personalize your website for your visitors via its API. (See 'business problems solved', further below.)

The support team are also very helpful and reliable -- which is another big bonus. Compared to other martech apps, they stand head and shoulders above.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Rarely, the interface can act clunky in certain sections (the same with most automation software) -- although this is usually rectified quickly. If not, I just let the team know and they sort it...

There isn't much else to say here!

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
-- Ensure you have a good developer on your side if you want the best from this product
-- As with any automation software, plan ahead and don't just expect to use it perfectly from day 1
-- Lean on the support team if you need anything

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
Wishpond is the primary tool I use to collect, engage, and convert subscribers.

The primary reason I recommend Wishpond is its flexibility -- it's extremely adaptable; the API has been complexly used on my site to personalize the entire customer journey.

While ClickFunnels and Leadpages have their strengths, Wishpond is more of a multi-purpose all-in-one tool that also accommodates the whole email automation side, too (something not typically included in other platforms at the same price level).

For this reason (plus the API), it's a very powerful piece of kit to own.

To sum up: I love Wishpond for its scalability, adaptability, simple user interface, and its many features -- often provided separately in other platforms. I like one place, one price."

What do you like best about Wishpond?
Nothing. The problem with Wishpond is they don't have any regards for their customers. We identified them as a potential service we would use for our eCommerce business & enrolled in the trial. For some reason, they have a trial for an annual subscription but not for monthly. We learnt that the hard way when we signed up for monthly service and later on realised that we were charged. Even after repeated discussion, they didn't agree to refund, even though it was just five days after the signup.
.
The excuse for not refunding the money was, we created a campaign, and it was performing really "good", so what if it is performing good. You should think this as a testament that your platform works and if the customer is happy, they will certainly subscribe. Actually, we shared the communication we had with Wishpond to our team and discussed what you should never do, so I would say we paid to learn how we should not treat our customers.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Coming to the "Good campaign" part
Basically, Wishpond provides a bunch of options/tasks that a subscriber can do to gain points in leader board and win the giveaway. The tasks are link subscribe to YouTube channel, follow Instagram profile etc. Now insight info is that they have no tracking if the task is complete or not. They just track the link click. Also, there is no way to track spamming. Although the campaign was working really "well" as per Wishpond team, the data was full of spams, invalid email ids, and bottom line useless.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
Get leads by creating a leaderboard for our giveaway.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
I love how exciting this feels.  The end products from Wishpond seem very polished.  They were so quick to start work on our first campaign and it was very easy to get in touch with my campaign manager.  I especially love the many features available within the program, without the need to integrate any other programs.  I may be able to cancel my email marketing program and merge everything over to Wishpond!   So far, Wishpond has most of my needs covered and lots of "wants" that I hadn't expected.  Customer service has been stellar.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Not much to say just yet.  We recently signed on and have yet to really dig deep into the DIY aspect of Wishpond.  I'm sure, as time goes on, that I'll find small things that perhaps I would like to see changed.  However, if they're program maintenance is as dependable as their customer service, then I'm not too concerned.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
Take the time to ask the questions.  You should walk away from any potential relationship with confidence that you understand everything discussed.  If your rep doesn't want to take the time, then ask for someone else.  I had a great experience with Dan and I hope all the reps at Wishpond are just as competent and patient.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are a small (almost micro) business with hands-on knowledge. Trouble is, we haven't had much 'hands-on' with marketing.  It's not something we went to school to learn.  I enjoy adding skills to my portfolio, but when quick decisions need to be made, sometimes the learning curve is too slow.

all_reviews.review_title: Automations break down regularly, forms mess with Facebook Pixel, just a terrible experience overall
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
The LP and form builders are ok, but they're hard to use and bug out.
The tracking system would also be great if it didn't break down very often.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
We've so far had to create 4 work around automations because their automations keep bugging or breaking down (we were once flooded with duplicate leads just because they opened an email, for example). It's been months since they first told us they'd fix them, got a bunch of extended ETAs since then, they're still not fixed.
If you duplicate a form and put on a different page, it will mix them up. We got tons of leads that didn't fire the Facebook Pixel because Wishpond is mixing the forms up and they go to the wrong page.
Also, to downgrade to a monthly plan after encountering countless issues that had us working on eliminating duplicates and coming up with creative ways to make this deeply flawed software work somehow, we had to send a lot of emails with no response, only to finally get the downgrade after we resorted to threats. Even though they'd normally respond in a day (with no solution, however), they took their sweet time responding to the downgrade emails.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
So far, close to zilch.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
I've been using Wishpond for over two years now and I really enjoy it. There are a plethora of templates to choose from for any given contest I wish to run on multiple social platforms. I like that I can change the artwork within each to brand it and run different campaigns for different purposes.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
While initially I would say the price of WIshpond is a bit high, it does allow me to create multiple contests throughout the year - as many as I'd like. However, there is actually an additional cost above the annual fee when it comes to attempting to have a truly successful campaign -- due to the social platform algorithms, unless I put money behind my contests to boost posts and run ads, nobody sees the contest is live and conversions are small, if there are any conversions at all.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
I would not necessarily utilize this product unless you're intending to run more than one contest a month. For the annual rate, you truly do need to be running 2-3 contests a month to get your money's worth.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
What we're attempting to solve is attracting new leads as well as retaining those we've already captured by giving them opportunities to interact with us and win prizes throughout the year.

all_reviews.review_title: Flexible, usable tool for many digital marketing tasks.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
I currently use Wishpond for a variety of functions, from WYSIWYG landing page creation, to embeddable forms, to email automation for prospecting and lead nurturing. The fact that I can stay in one intuitive product for all of these purposes allows me to focus my learning curve and attention in one place, and it also minimizes time spent on integrations.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
The only note I have on Wishpond is that the interface and functionality can be slightly different from tool to tool, This is not a huge deal, but it does force the user to "relearn" a bit when going from landing page WYSIWG to the email composer, for example.  It makes it apparent that they have different teams developing each functional component, and those teams could do a bit more to cross-reference UX to make the user experience more consistent from tool to tool. One other piece I would enjoy would be stronger mentorship from Wishpond on how to integrate landing pages/forms into my organization's larger Google Analytics reporting... they have strong in=app reporting, but it feels a bit separate from the goings-on across my larger website, making conversion assist analyses a bit challenging.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
This product is fantastic for an entrepreneurial growth hacker looking for an integrated solution. It's easy to learn and generates quality flexible marketing products. It strikes me as a ideal for SMB users.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
Wishpond allows me as a non-technical marketer to move at the speed of business on digital campaigns/webpage creation, without being slowed by the development team's large queue. It also allows me to own marketing automation/lead nurturing before delivering leads over to internal partners who use different CRM systems.

all_reviews.review_title: The Simplest Way to Create Effective Social Campaigns!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
The variety of social campaigns and templates available, ease of generating/maintaining those campaigns. Creating A/B split tests offers the possibility to discover new preferences your customer base might have when it comes to shopping, browsing, interacting with your brand. The ability to edit a campaign while it's running lets us make adjustments and last minute calls based on immediate outcomes and any unplanned changes.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Folders to organize social campaigns would be a nice additional feature. Possibly adding a template that is nearly minimal and can be manipulated to match branding more closely.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
Worth the investment, even just for running social campaigns. My favorite feature is the ability to duplicate campaigns! Reduces the time it takes to create copy, as well as making it simple to improve upon and replicate already successful campaigns. Changes can be made while a campaign is active, which eliminates the need to re-post any shared content down the line. Support is so incredibly helpful! The Live Chat feature has saved me the stress of launching a campaign we're unsure of. Any emails I've sent in regards to platform issues or additional information on internal automation have been answered in a timely manner.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're currently utilizing Wishpond's services to promote a new brand and gain new contacts across all social media platforms via use of the Sweepstakes campaign tool. Wishpond makes it easy to monitor our sweepstakes performance, integrate sharing, export leads/contacts, and get creative with our campaign aesthetics! We've seen great success with using these services in combination with our paid Facebook/Instagram advertising campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
It's so simple to use and offers a range of inbound solutions to kickstart your lead gen activity. I've primarily used the pop-up campaigns that lead into a range of marketing automation workflows. But aside from that I know I'll utilise the social contests and landing pages in the near future.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Honestly, I'm yet to find anything to dislike. I do suspect though as we lean more on Wishpond to implement inbound activities we'll be looking to see more solutions from Wishpond. But I have confidence that they have attention firmly on developing their offering.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
Try the 14 day free trial. You'll see how easy is to implement and the scope of solutions it provides.

It really is a great foray for businesses of all sizes to start getting into landing pages, social contests, marketing automation and general lead gen.

Be sure to lean on their customer service team. They've been fantastic.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Creating Landing Page Campaigns and More with Fishpond
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
What I like the most is how easy it is to modify the templates they provide and to create different landing page and email campaigns.  Being a newbie I needed a lot of support and the Wishpond staff was always there.  Their knowledge base is quite extensive and easy to follow.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Being a newbie its hard for me to tell what I do not like so far.  I imagine that with time I'll find some things.  One thing I do find difficult, or should I say confusing is that there are so many options...like lead database, popups, twitter campaigns, marketing automation that it is a bit frustrating to deal with the degree of complexity, because all these things are or seem to be integrated.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
If you want an integrated solution, this one feels very complete.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am creating a course and need tools to market it.  Tools like email campaigns, landing pages, lead database management., Facebook lead pages, Twitter Campaigns.   A benefit I see over other options I've explored is that everything is in one place.  I sense that there are things I do not even know are possible to do.  I sense that here I'll be able to find them.  The pricing is very competitive for what is offered.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Wishpond?
The customer service is the best I have ever received, anywhere - especially considering I am currently on a free package. Any time I am online there is always somebody available to chat, and Lucy and Jordan have been at the end of an email within minutes. The modular design is great, and the ability to design a landing page from scratch, without having to use a template.

What do you dislike about Wishpond?
Maybe it's just that I haven't found it, but some form of instructions or overview would be useful. Some of it is intuitive, but not all, and I've had to ask questions that I wouldn't have had to if there'd been a user guide. If there IS a user guide, it needs to be a lot more prominent! The text handling can be temperamental, and the text editing tool bar gets in the way of the text you're trying to enter or modify.

Recommendations to others considering Wishpond:
If you're not sure, just sign up for the free package. This will let you have up to 200 leads - plenty of time to review the software and service and decide whether it's for you before upgrading to a paid package.

What problems is Wishpond solving and how is that benefiting you?
I love that the software allows me to build a professional-looking landing page, plus a thank you page, collects and stores email leads for me, shows me views and conversions, and allows me to email leads. All of this in one handy package.
